title: Lonely Carnival
credit_line: Gift of Mr. and Mrs. James H. Beal
provenance_text:
Benton Murdoch Spruance [1904-1967], Philadelphia, PA. Mr. [1898-1987] and Mrs. James H. Beal (born Rebecca Huebley Jones) [1898-1993], Pittsburgh, PA, by 1951 until March 25, 1959 [1]; gift to Department of Fine Arts, Carnegie Institute, Pittsburgh, PA, March 1959 [2].

Notes:
[1]. Mrs. Beal purchased the work for $450, sometime in or before 1951 (see Mrs. Beal's handwritten list of Benton Spruance lithographs and paintings in her collection as of sometime in 1951.)
[2]. The work was brought to Carnegie Institute for storage in January 1959. It was gifted later that year and accessioned on March 25, 1959.
